newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar ends slightly up on fund inflows.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar ends slightly up on fund inflows.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar closed slightly higher against the U.S. dollar on Monday amid inflows of foreign equity funds, dealers said.
The local unit ended at T$27.473 against Saturday's T$27.476 close. Turnover was a modest US$160.5 million.

Dealers said there was downward pressure on the Taiwan dollar after the central bank cut banks' reserve requirements on Friday in a move to boost the economy, but that the local unit had rebounded by the close of business.
"Foreign fund inflows reversed the trend," said one dealer.
Dealers said they expected more foreign funds to flow in this week as Morgan Stanley prepared to start including Taiwan's stock index in its global stock indices from September 2.
"However, foreign fund inflows may only push up the Taiwan dollar or put it in a stable range for a short period of time," one dealer said.
"Then, the Taiwan dollar will tend to fall to test T$27.8 again as Taiwan's economy still shows sluggish growth and needs Taiwan dollar depreciation to boost its exports."
A T$27.46-27.49 range was seen for Tuesday.
